name: Fish Tacos
description: Light and flavorful Mexican tacos with fresh seasoned fish, crunchy cabbage slaw, and creamy chipotle sauce.

ingredients.name: White fish fillet (sea bass, sea bream, or cod)

instructions.instruction: Rub fish fillets with paprika, cumin, garlic powder, half salt, and pepper.
Squeeze 1 lime over fish, marinate 10 minutes.
For chipotle crema, mix mayonnaise, yogurt, juice of 1 lime, chipotle sauce, and remaining salt.
For slaw, combine shredded cabbage, carrot, half the cilantro, and remaining lime juice.
Heat olive oil in large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Cook 3-4 minutes per side until golden and cooked through.
Roughly flake cooked fish with fork.
Warm tortillas in dry pan or directly over flame 20 seconds each side.
instructions.tip: Should puff slightly and be pliable.

instructions.instruction: Place some slaw in center of each tortilla.
Top slaw with seasoned fish pieces.
Garnish with avocado slices and remaining fresh cilantro.

tips: Use freshest fish possible - it shows in tacos.
Shrimp or tuna also make great alternatives.
No chipotle? Use sriracha or any hot sauce.
Corn tortillas give more authentic flavor.
storageInfo: Fish and sauce store separately 2 days. Assemble tacos at serving time.
servingSuggestion: Serve with Mexican rice and refried beans.
variations: Battered: Coat fish in beer batter and fry.
Shrimp: Use spiced shrimp instead of fish.
Grilled: Cook on grill or grill pan.
